org.eclipse.dataset.slicer

Class Slicer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.dataset.slicer.Slicer

  • public class Slicer
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods for slicing data using visit patterns. This is Jakes algorithm moved out of the conversion API to make more use of it.

      This method provides a way to slice over a lazy dataset providing the values in each dimension for the slice using a visit pattern.

      • getSize

        public static int getSize(ILazyDataset lz,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> sliceDimensions)
        Parameters:
        lz -
        sliceDimensions -
        Returns:

      • visitAllParallel

        public static void visitAllParallel(ILazyDataset lz,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> sliceDimensions,
                                    java.lang.String nameFragment,
                                    SliceVisitor visitor)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method provides a way to slice over a lazy dataset providing the values in each dimension for the slice using a visit pattern. The call on to the SliceVisitor is done in a parallel way by delegating the calling of the visit method to a thread pool. Blocks until complete or timeout of 5s is reached.
        Parameters:
        lz -
        sliceDimensions -
        nameFragment - may be null
        visitor - - if used with visitAllParallel, visit should not normally throw an exception or if it does it will stop the execution but not throw back to the calling code. Instead an internal RuntimeException is thrown back to the fork/join API.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • visitAllParallel

        public static void visitAllParallel(ILazyDataset lz,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> sliceDimensions,
                                    java.lang.String nameFragment,
                                    SliceVisitor visitor,
                                    long timeout)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method provides a way to slice over a lazy dataset providing the values in each dimension for the slice using a visit pattern. The call on to the SliceVisitor is done in a parallel way by delegating the calling of the visit method to a thread pool. Blocks until complete or timeout is reached.
        Parameters:
        lz -
        sliceDimensions -
        nameFragment - may be null
        visitor - - if used with visitAllParallel, visit should not normally throw an exception or if it does it will stop the execution but not throw back to the calling code. Instead an internal RuntimeException is thrown back to the fork/join API.
        timeout - in ms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
